Instructions.laneInstrOne: A Kanban board consists of lanes and cards. Each lane is a unique value in a field in the source table. Lanes can come from many different fields: status, assignee, month, etc.
Instructions.laneInstrTwo: Each card is a record that belongs in that lane.
Instructions.laneInstrThree: Choose a value list, a field that will sort cards into lanes, and a field by which the cards will be sorted.
Instructions.laneValListInstr: The value list defines the lanes, and the order of the values in that list determines the lanes' order. The value list can be hard coded or come from a field in a table.
Instructions.lanePlacementInstr: The 'Lane Placement Field' determines into which lane each card is placed. Use the field that corresponds to the chosen value list.
Instructions.laneSortInstr: Pick the field by which the cards in the lanes will be sorted. You can have multiple sorts in a table, one for each way you wish to define the lanes.
